definition: to take a percentage of the winnings (in gambling)/tap (in an electromagnetic coil)/drawer (of a desk etc)
to draw out/to pull out from in between/to remove part of the whole/(of certain plants) to sprout or bud/to whip or thrash
head/hair style/the top/end/beginning or end/a stub/remnant/chief/boss/side/aspect/first/leading/classifier for pigs or livestock/CL:個|个[ge4]

sentences.english: Adopted with double taps. fixed with two vacuum meters used independently or parallelly .
sentences.chinese: 本機採用雙抽頭，可單獨或並聯使用裝有兩個真空表。

sentences.english: If the filament transformer has a center tap, don't use it.
sentences.chinese: 如果變壓器燈絲繞組有抽頭，請不要使用它。
單極控制器需要中心抽頭繞組。

sentences.english: This is the first report about general developing aspect of SAW programmable tapped delay line (SAW-PTDL)in our institute.
sentences.chinese: 報道聲表面波可程序抽頭延遲線的研製情況。

sentences.english: This paper presents the implementation of non-communication protection for distribution networks with tapped-off-loads.
sentences.chinese: 本文介紹了實施非抽頭負載的分銷網絡與通信保護。

sentences.english: Pre-tapped mounting holes and a hollow-through shaft permit a variety of machine designs.
sentences.chinese: 預抽頭安裝孔和一個空心軸允許各種不同的機器設計。
